intro: Argostemma albovenatum, commonly known as the white-veined argostemma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white or pale green flowers with prominent veins. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. It is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth.
